text: this has to be the prettiest lentil
salad you've ever seen there are a lot
of lentil salad recipes that are on the
brown side but not this one
I take colorful vegetables roast them
and then when they're sweet and
caramelized I toss them with the lentils
and I add a sherry vinaigrette it is so
flavorful and it makes a lot so you can
keep it on hand for a week you can use
any vegetables for roasting for the
lentils the key is you want all of them
to roast at the same time and you want
to use a lot of colors because you want
this to be pretty so I've got some
squash celery root which never gets
enough love carrots and two different
kinds of beets golden and red and season
them really well with salt pepper and
then lots of olive oil olive oil is key
here not just for flavor but for
browning use your hands cuz that's the
most thorough way to go and then make
sure that you Pat them down into one
layer even just a couple of sprigs of
fresh herbs add a ton of flavor you want
to cover this at the beginning because
at first I'm going to start steaming the
vegetables then I'm going to take the
foil off and I'm going to let them get
some color so I've got the vegetables
done about halfway and now I'm going to
add the bacon instead of frying bacon
and adding it later I'm just going to
let the bacon roast with the vegetables
because you know what you're eating
lentils lentils are really good for you
so you need some bacon to balance it all
and now I'm not covering it because I
want it to get brown at this point and
this is what it looks like when it's all
done bacon is nice and brown so are the
vegetables they're tender now I'm going
to get my lentils I just cook these and
with some garlic and bay leaf and I'm
going to toss this with some vinaigrette
it's important that the lentils are warm
when you add the vinaigrette because it
absorbs it better there's still some
garlic in here which I could take out
but I believe it because boiling it with
the lentils makes it really sweet and
tender
and then I just have radicular
a little more of the vinaigrette not
quite all of it get your hands in there
cuz how do you know if it's dressed or
not unless you feel it and now I'm gonna
add the roasted veg it will keep in your
fridge for about a week just don't add
the radicchio keep the radicchio for
serving and we put it in the fridge just
use the lentils and the vegetables once
I add the vegetables to the lentils you
just want to toss very gently because
you don't want to break them up again
hands are best for this because that way
you can be very gentle a metal spoon is
just gonna bang it all up part of
serving the salad is garnishing it so I
want to add a lot of green at the top so
I have some parsley and scallion I'm
gonna use both the white and the green
here the green is a little bit more
fresh bright kind of Irby and the white
is a little bit sweeter radicchio goes
on the bottom just a little bit more
salt I'm gonna add it before I add the
lentils otherwise the radicchio will be
bland and the lentils will be perfect
you can serve this salad warm you could
serve it at room temperature but if
you're making a head and put it in the
fridge take it out of the fridge for a
little bit because you don't want it to
be cold now I'm gonna add just a little
bit of tangerine juice the first time I
made this salad I happened to have a
bowl of tangerines on the counter so I
just grabbed one and it was a perfect
thing it had a little bit of acid but it
also had a little bit of sweetness and
it was also of this bright flavor that
you don't usually associate with lentils
scallions this is a giant lentil salad
this lentil salad screams party this is
a party lentil salad and all of your
guests will love it
Oh
